global_property.description: Pipe-separated list specifying each task name that is supported by the module. Allowed values are 'patientRegistration', 'primaryCareReception', 'primaryCareVisit', 'patientLookup', and 'reporting'
Primary identifier type for looking up patients, generating barcodes, etc
Name or primary key id of the Encounter Type that should be used when recording Patient Registration encounters
The person attribute type to print on the id card
Name of the class that provides the search algorithm to use when searching for a patient
Pipe-separated list of either location names or ids in order to limit the locations available for patient registration. If empty, all locations are supported
Number of copies of a patient's registration label to print
Pipe-separated list specifying each provider role that is supported by the module. Example: lacollineProvider|mirebalaisProvider
The provider identifier type (doctor stamp ID)
Convenient set used to pop-up an alert when a diagnosis from this list is selected.
Convenient set used to highlight in the UI the nationally notifying diseases.

global_property.property_value: PIH: ZL Primary care diagnosis non-coded
global_property.description: Concept used for the non-coded diagnosis question in the primary care visit workflow
Convenient set used to filter out the neonatal diseases.
Name or primary key id of the Encounter Type that should be used when recording Primary Care Visit encounters
Concept used for the coded diagnosis question in the primary care visit workflow
Convenient set used to pop-up an alert when a diagnosis from this list is selected.

global_property.property_value: PIH: Receipt number|en:Receipt Number|ht:Nimewo Resi a
global_property.description: Concept used for the receipt number question in the primary care reception workflow

global_property.property_value: PIH: Patient payment status|en:Payment type|ht:Fason pou peye
global_property.description: Concept used for the payment question in the primary care reception workflow
Name or primary key id of the Encounter Type that should be used when recording Primary Care Reception encounters
Additional identifier type used for entering dossier numbers
Label text to print on the id card
Reference to the ICD10 concept source
The number of years(n) to be added or subtracted(+/- n) from the DOB year in order to determine if a patient is a duplicate.
